They start ignoring balance in the game. A lot of broken weapons need to be balanced right now. We've been waiting 7 months to balance only one weapon HV40, but there are more than 50 balance problems right now, and devs just ignore it!
And in recent time we have alt accounts / griefers problems! People buy accounts (giving devs money) and just ruining game to opposite faction. And what devs do to fix it? They start banning people who report that cheaters!
It was the last straw...
People start making negative reviews on steam, one faction even stop playing and start losing game... And what devs do? They increase respawn timer to winning faction, to stop them winning, to keep people in losing faction in the game. That was pathetic and the last straw for me.
Well done developers, you are just ruining your own child.
Developers need to introduce moderation to prevent people from ruining the game for others.
it's different from what I'm used to, but its a fun game
Good  game

Great Community with terrible moderators (using power) and developers. the don't give a fuck anymore

Devs Got Worse since then a lot. Game went to shit.

There are some good news about this game, but mostly are bad. 

First of all: the idea is awesome. There is no game like this. You really fell like a cog in an enormous machine. Everything is player driven an player made, and you feel like a soldier in the ocean of war. The comunity is mostly helpful.

Now the bad news: Early game is extremely boring, there are some game changer bugs that devs do not do anything about, dev team do not listen to us, they follow the "vision" like an eretic will do. 1.0 was rushed and  not balanced, facilities require your life to work, supplies are the most cancerous thing to do with people fighting for spots to make them.
Nukes work whenever they want and the game is extremely noob unfriendly, with no tutotrial and no ingame help. Do not misunderstand me, to know a little about this game you need aabout 500 to 700 hours of play.

I love Foxhole! I only wish the developers would appreciate the love and dedication the player base has put into their game but developer communication has fallen off dramatically over the years, Blatant bugs and alt accounts/griefers still run rampant with no changes, the comms system dilemma still hinders the community more so than helping it, and the only quality of life updates we've seen have added more work, stress, and micro-management to the game which has ultimately led toward more factionalism within the game and consistent squabbles among teammates. 

Again, I love Foxhole! I just wish the developers would show us that they loved it too. Don't worry though, Anvil will make everything better and won't suffer from the same issues of course!

A once great game with amazing potential driven into the wall by developers.

This game has been suffering from severe and glaring issues for years yet the developers refuse to make meaningfull changes, listen to the community (the lifeblood of any, but especially this, online game), or at this point communicate at all.

Some of these issues include:

- Extremely tedious gameplay aspects with ever worsening QOL (Logistics, Building, Facilities)

- Horrible moderation system that does nothing to prevent serious offenses while at the same time penalizing players, who actively contribute to the community (Communications Rating, Report System)

- Locking individual players and at this point even small groups out of a large part, if not most of the games content. A lot of content is so time-consuming and tedious that its not feasible for a single player or even a small group to engage with it.

- Omnipresent and devastating griefing. This problem is intensified by those previously named as a single griefer can destroy something that took days to build or produce within minutes, can cripple entire frontlines by sabotaging bunkers etc. These griefers to not receive permanent bans but are at most banned for a few days. There is no strike system and these players can return as many times as they want, the community has found profiles with several pages of violation logs, yet nothing is done about it. Most are probably not even penalized at all as there is no active human moderation or oversight.

In short:
As a new player you will be locked out of most and especially most of the impactful content.
You will waste hours or days of your time grinding for resources or holding left click to build buildings.
And most likely your work will be destroyed in minutes or crumble to nothingness as you cant keep up with the time and material demand of upkeep.

Overall I can not recommend this game to anyone as long as these issues are not adressed by the developers. 
But hey at least they are now developing a new game which is actually exactly the same as this one but medieval.........

The need to update this review and change it from recommending this game to not recommending this game does pain me. I don't see myself playing this game must into the future as the developers continue to have near non existent communication with the community, a continued back and forth of "Clan Man" bad and "Hey, you need to basically join a regiment to use this or even see it in-game."  

It continues with an insane grind that isn't terrible if you like a second job, or don't mind hours of work being lost in seconds because of something that was bugged or needed to be fixed. Features that are QoL {Quality of Life}, are far and few, why no sprinkler system to help with fires, a water tank that requires it to be filled or piped from a water source, why no features for regiments, or features for those that wanna play solo. Why no change to the level/commend features to help new players, I can only speak for the few I've seen and spoken to, but those that I have, and including myself see nothing positive about this system. 

The next major update was predicated from context given by the devs that it will focus naval, one of the most useless and untouched parts of the game. Why? Because the map is largely land over water. Transportation via boats however is very useful. Why no new or updated maps? Because the developers said so.. no really because they don't wanna, there is preset lore and all for other maps, and why not use things that have occurred in wars to cause map changes.

The development cycle isn't always terrible, but that's because the three minor updates between the major updates are fixes for the large amount of bugs and issues with the major updates. They also seem to focus heavily on adding vehicles, most of which require you to be in a regiment to even look at, or even be considered to use. 

The game continues to focus on one side of the player base giving near realistic updates, rather then the displayed Iron Harvest style game that we all so hoped for. 



I don't like ranting and there is honestly alot more to say, but it's nice to be able to get a few of the commonly known issues in the reviews to honestly prevent a waste of money on a game, that went from 300 players to near 7k, back down to 2k. It's only a matter of time before the game dips again, most likely a few wars after the milestone war 100.

Great game, nothing quite like it. It's a war MMO with a focus on logistics - all weapons, ammo, vehicles, artillery, shells, spawns, buildings etc are created by players and brought to the frontlines to be used. Community is mostly great, lots of good vibes. It is an online game, so of course there's some nut jobs here and there.

Can be played solo - 90+% of my time in game has been a solo player. Even better with a couple of mates, as vehicles like tanks need 2-3 players to use effectively. Joining up with other randoms works just fine too.

Wars last around a week to a month, though the current war has been going about 40 days and nerves are fried for all, hence the current saltiness of recent reviews. It's also a pretty close knit community, so drama can get out of hand pretty quick, best to simply ignore it.
Very rarely see cheating or griefing, definitely less than any other online game i've played, but it does exist of course.

Mostly works well, can be slightly buggy here and there. Might lose connection when crossing to different zones for example, but it's (usually) quick and easy to get back in where you were.

Can also be pretty grindy if you let it be - some players do nothing but grind for resources for example and rarely if ever fight. Some players do no logistics at all, and only fight. Play it how you want to play it - if I get worn out fighting and dying in the meat grinder that is the front lines, I might do some logistics for a while or move to a different front, or perhaps sneak behind enemy lines and disrupt their logistics. Lots of things to do, make your own missions.

Worth the price, but watch some videos of it before committing, it's not a game that everyone will enjoy - there's no power fantasy here. Death is fast and brutal, which makes teamwork essential and victory sweet.
Bring back tech parts and gun turret and delete trench and industry

Foxhole is an exercise in wild and contrasting opposites.

It's a wonderful example of the glory and beauty of hundreds of people playing towards victory. It's riddled with griefers and alts who are capable of undoing the work that took you several days in less than a few minutes.

It has a level of complexity in warfare that can only be matched by factorio-like games (Yes, that's right, it's a factory game disguised as a war game). Yet all of that gameplay is accessed by less than half the playerbse, probably less than a third of the playerbase if I'm quite honest.

It's a slick and complex top-down shooter. And at the same time the devs seem to add new toys without rhyme or reason, while nerfing in a seemingly haphazard and careless way.

It's glorious and horrifying all at once, which I suppose is a philosophical statement about war in general. And I cannot go far enough in recommending you steer clear of this thing. Do not buy it until the devs begin communicating properly. Do not spend your time here until there is a semblence of long-term balance. Don't commit your time which can be wasted and undone oh, so easily.

Everything is this game that isn't shooting a gun or otherwise fighting on the frontline is an excercise in frustration, monotony and a short road to burning out.

+great fights on the frontline
+running a tank crew/line with your bros is great fun

-making guns and ammo is boooring and seems to be designed to burn people out
-moving said guns and ammo takes ages due to arbitrarily long wait times to 'pull' items from storage (especially if it's on a public storage)

and that's just basic logistics.

the whole game used to just be basic logistics and that's somewhat managable in bitesize pieces.
however the 1.0 update completely ruined this loop by shoving in a factorio 'minigame'  except they forgot the automation part.  everything is manual. 

want anything but a basic vehicle? 
build a whole base by gathering materials and driving them tot he buildsite then spend literal hours holding leftmousebutton to build (or use windows clicklock if you don't like carpel tunnel)
gather materials and wait for the basic materials to craft
then manually move them to another building and wait for the advanced material to craft
then manually move them to another building and drive in the vehicle that you also had to farm and craft to modify it.
wait some more
finally you have a drivable vehicle.

and you just wasted 1-2 hours not doing anything fun.


and that's not even talking about alt, griefers and the toxicity that the players will throw at you to make the whole process even more frustrating. 
and the devs being absolutely incommunicative about community concerns and feedback regarding any of this.
amazing war simulator.

The issue is not with the game itself - it is the administration/no-lifers who inhabit it.

New to the game and do something remotely wrong? You will be mass reported because some raging child thinks you're an alt (short for alt account working for the enemy "team"). This will cause the automatic ban system to suspend you.
Once you have a single suspension on record, the flood gates are opened.

In any situation going forth, doing anything remotely wrong will result in lengthier suspensions until you are permanently banned. 30 dollars down the drain. It's a shame because the game itself is quite fun.
Balance problems favouring one faction over the other.

Naw, this game sucks. Don't even bother. This is a dead end. 
So what you're going to want to do is turn around, head over to the Purple Dragon
Take a right then look for the railroad tracks. If you see them YOU WENT TOO FAR.
But keep going and dont stop until you see a game that is actually fun and worth your time.

Updated Review: 

In the past I highly recommended this game. It's with great displeasure that I no longer recommend it, at least for the time being. Their have been long standing game-breaking bugs and the devs continue to show a lack of remorse/care for their community.
Foxhole is a game with excellent core gameplay, but a poor developer-community relationship. I've been taking a hiatus until more quality-of-life changes are implemented.

TL;DR I used to love it but the players and devs ruined it, do not buy

I used to have so much fun playing this game that I played it almost like a job, I logged on and had good times with buddies and it was good. You could carry dozens of magazines of ammo and run around behind enemy lines and just annihilate them, the vehicles were fun, the balance while not perfect was good enough. The playerbase and the devs combined their efforts and fucking ruined this shit. It started with the tech system and all these stupid hidden mechanics in the background made by the devs and then a whole bunch of literal transsexuals began to monopolize the tech, it was not so bad but it was more than annoying when they chose actual garbage because of a vote (because the military will vote on things right guys?) This on its own was not the end of the world. however on top of this all you would see is people spamming the word cum (thank God they censored this, but it took over a year of bleeding players for the devs to finally do something about this. Which is a reoccurring issue with them) This and other disgusting speech was (and still is) prevalent throughout the playerbase, especially on the warden side. However i could live with these things a little bit, as I could go with a couple friends and bang out logi and tanks and everything pretty simply and have a good time blowing things up on the front. Then 1.0 came out and the devs spit in the face of solo players entirely, they changed the tech system, the production system for most things, and made everything about building 10x worse. Building in this game was tedious at best before this update and now its a downright slog. If you are a solo or small group player you can go fuck yourself in this game. You want to get a tank? Cant just go to a garage and smack one together with public or self farmed materials, you now have to go to a production facility that is player built. There are the occasional public ones but good luck actually producing anything there. The rest are all clan owned, clannies are the scum of the earth. I logged in more recently and first thing I did was grab a motorcycle that was sitting in the middle of one of these facilities, within 30 seconds some little pissant clannie comes out and starts trying to teamkill me, then I defend myself and drive off with the bike. Not 5 minutes later I am getting DM'd about being an alt account although I have 400 hours in the game. The levels of paranoia and greed among clannies is second to none. They monopolize all the resources and want you to slave away to grind out weapons and vehicles for them, if you resist or take even a little from them they will dogpile you and will literally mass report you until you arent able to play the game anymore. This happens if you do nearly anything to upset them. Streamers who play this game do the same shit and can alone summon a swarm of mouthbreathers to get you off the game for, get this, building a bridge or trench they dislike. These problems are rampant and the devs do nothing to solve them, and on top of this make it worse by making the game unplayable unless you're a clannies slave.
This review is kind of a ramble but I hope it gets the point across that this game is not fun and you should save your money until the situation improves or you find another game that is better.
Good game, better with friends

One of the coolest ideas for an MMO. Unfortunately the dev team is one of the worst I have ever seen. Their main focus is on making the game more grindy and wasting more of your time to do essential things. They never communicate with their community on glaring issues, or common complaints. The only time they interact is when there is a new update. Even then, 50% of the stuff they show off is horribly designed so no one ends up using it or actively makes the game less fun to play. These terrible systems then live on until the end of time, never being fixed in any meaningful way.
EPIC GAME !! giant coalitions and factory's or small spec ops what ever you think a WWI setting can bring .... THIS IS IT it maby have a fla or to here and there but in time it will be better  :D

"Foxhole, an Isometric 3rd person shooter where almost every bullet, rifle, grenade, truck, tank, train, and gunboat has been built by a player. You can Join a squad or a clan and organize attacks upon player built fortifications against players in real time. The game has a great experience the horrors of the front-line or the deadly raids on player managed logistics. Entire player made factories can churn out death and destruction that can bring your side to victory."  This is the quote that brought me to the game and has kept me in the game playing. I find the very concept of the game incredibly novel and even with a confusing learning curve, incredibly engaging. Knowing that every tank we lose or kill will set us or the enemy back potential hours or days of material collection really brings the effects of a front-line soldier or a truck driver into scale. 

That being said, this game does have it issues. At the time of writing this there is a review bomb that has been loosely organized through reddit going on. I personally disagree with the actions being taken by the players here, but there is a point to it.
There has been several longstanding issues with the game primarily with the bugs and the griefing. It is important to note that has been a couple "Forever wars" here in the past few months, Wars usually last a week or two but this current one is approaching two months. This war has been plagued by a massive amount of Alt accounts and if you dont know, "alting" is a form of griefing by having a second account to destroy supplies, teamkill, or otherwise be a hinderance to the opposing side. Siege Camp has been silent on the issue and the punishments in place do little to discourage it. It has been incredibly demoralizing for all players. 
The Bugs have been a different issue entirely, its not uncommon to run into a minor bug, "ghostly soldier just walking across no man's land" is my favorite and is a harmless bug. There are however much more harmful bugs in play. The late game nuke missiles require a massive amount of planning, and a dedicated spotter on the ground to guild the nuke into position. Normally when the spotter dies all targeting of the nuke is lost, unless it bugs and continues to target the nuke. This is major issue that hasn't been addressed for almost 20 wars. Many players are tired of the unfixed bugs and the lack of any meaningful attempts to address the griefing.  

I feel that i must recommend the game though in spite of it's flaws, even though the game can be very hard to learn, it feel so satisfying to figure out. If im pounding my head against a wall of lead on the frontlines i can go mine salvage on the backlines to vent my frustrations while still trying to assist in the fight. You dont get that experience in any other game.

My last note is to the review bombers: I get your point, but this entire "cancel the game!" mentality will not benefit this game. Your actions here speak volumes on why players get the impression that the community is a toxic heap. Shame on you.

TLDR; The game used to be sucks, it's now really REALLY sucks now.

Foxhole is a unique multiplayer Top-down Third person shooter that used to be a lot more simple. Then, Devs expand the map, Added asymmetry that break balance. Never listen to community unless held on gunpoint. keep adding new stuffs player NEVER asked for. Now everything you do in the game is such a pain the neck. 

- The game is riddled with glitch and bugs as well as frequent server crash, especially during heated frontline combat.
- EXTREMELY unoptimized, reaching 60+ FPS is almost impossible
- Not Optimized for 2k or above resolution, everything become too small to read
- Small Monitor got their view range much smaller than big screen and not compensated whatsoever
- There's no tutorial, the Island of which you spawn has VERY outdated stuff in it. Including barbed wires that you are required to get through prone.
- Most firearm in the game works on Hit scan, not bullet travel, and really dependent on latency if you are firing on moving target.
- Big caliber gun that is used on tanks are Hitscan with 100% accuracy that you can snipe infantry with it
- Technology Asymetry that break balance on every aspect of the game. Geometry, weather, tanks, firearm, artilery, etc. 
- 1 FACTION is being forced to stick with Bolt action rifle at the start of the war that is obsolete as soon as next new gun is unlocked.
- while the other one has Semi auto rifle that stay relevant until the end of the war and it's 1 of 2 cheapest rifle in the game
- That faction with bolt action rifle also start with Weaker, more expensive, logistically harder, less range starter grenade,
- A Group of role Playing soldier has been banned for... roleplaying, while we have cheater, saboteur alt accounts, and toxic mouthy manchild on the loose, every day, every war, with no consequences
- The community of reddit and discord are colored by 1 toxic faction. downvoting and reporting anything other faction says in mass. Just check reddit and see whose faction Talks the most, probably the one with biggest ego
- The game devs has nerfed 1 of the faction so badly that it's currently on the 5th loss
- The Player driven economy and logistic has been severely strained extremely thin before the implementation of facility, now we have no manpower to properly supply the front because that portion of manpower has been busy maintaining facility to stay running. every single frontline depot are always empty.
- The Griefing by enemy faction using alternative account are so bad that putting your tank in public depot will have 25% chance to be given to the enemy for free by griefer. Both faction are trying to dismissed this as clueless new player. Arseheads
- The vast majority of vehicle, previously easily made in garage are now facility Bltch now, you have to ask Clans/regiments to make it for you after you pay them with resources
- Some clans also like to hoard rare resources in the game that it got so bad that it turn into mini civil war. several regiments vs several regiments
- Reporting player with ticket does nothing, so far, NO ALT, CHEATHER, GRIEFER has been banned permanently. even IF they are, the game is very cheap when discounted. and devs never ban using IP. after all, they are ALL paying customer
- Devs are subsidized by government, so expect everything they make are Half-arsed.

Maybe at first glance it looks nice but when you get into the game you'll find alot of things that will annoy you:

1) community - griefers, cheaters, alt accounts helping opposite faction, people stealing stuff etc.. you'll see this each day you play this game.. Everything from each category I mentioned. Also clan drama etc.

2) bugs - get your vehicle stuck to a random spot or yourself, oh that spacebar button... no you can't jump here!!!  You wanna reload? oops, u can't shoot after reload because it was a fake reload!.. Wanna run across rubbles? Oops you just teleported to the nether.

3) You wanna join the frontline when there's a good fight? You wanna bring some logi to that frontline? Please wait in a queue for 1 hour or until your mates run dry on logi.

4) Updates? Well, something goes wrong each update. Either something gets nerfed in a bad way or something not well thought out gets introduced. 

5) Wanna build and not fight? Well, this will be a bad version of any strategy game for you! Wanna place that bunker piece here? Nah, u can't because either of a static bush or something invisible on the way. Building in general is kind of a waste of time. It takes too much effort to keep things up and running.. And the benefits of that are too small. This applies for both - factories and bunker bases. Concrete defences are just too weak. You won't be able to QRF when somebody attacks and it'll be over before you get there. Also howitzer garrisons got nerfed - not shooting back at tanks, infantry PvE-s etc.

6) scientists say gray matter in your brain decreases when you play that game

This game is not as good as the seminal classic, Among Us. 

The crewmates can do little against the imposters. Unlike in Among Us, where you can vote out the sussy imposters. The imposters in Foxhole cannot be voted out. There is no emergency meeting button in the home island so that the crewmates can vote on the imposter. Instead, you have to write to the devs and MAYBE they'll address it. Furthermore, the imposters have more abilities in Foxhole. Whereas in Among Us, the imposters can only sabotage, vent, transform and kill but in Foxhole, the imposters sabotaging abilities are very powerful. 

TLDR: Among Us is better. Also, the Charlie Warden loyalist clan [MOGUS] is the most real clan in Foxhole history.

Devs dont communicate at all with the community even if game breaking bugs appear/happen during wars, no ingame moderation and players that have repeatedly been caught cheating/alting/griefing dont get permanently banned for whatever reason. Balance also kinda wonky from time to time and QoL is pretty bad in some aspects of the game. Still fun but could be so much better. Also rather quit your Job if you want to start playing it unless you want to have 2.

So this is tough. I like this game a lot, I really do. I've played it more than 1000 hours, I've involved myself with clans, random pick up operations, frontline, tanking, logi, backline saboteur, partisan and more. I've seen more of this game than anyone can really be expected to, and some parts are absolutely amazing, completely unlike any other game out there.

But I just can't recommend it. It's not in a good state right now. There are bad actors acting in bad faith, sabotaging their own team. There are systems that encourage hoarding of resources, that divide the team into factions instead of uniting them against a common foe. There are extremely obtuse, confusing and counter-intuitive mechanics that are difficult to learn even with help, and basically impossible without the organization of a clan. Which is all fine for a game if it just needed a little polish. But it's more than that now.

This game is supposed to be finished. It's past 1.0 release, and there is little to no communication from the devs, new content that is actively counter to their stated goals, and still no effective moderation system. Neither in game moderators that can ban bad actors, nor in-game systems to help the community police themselves. 

It pains me to write this, because I am very passionate about this game, and it could be a 10/10 yes play this game recommendation. But it just isn't, because this game isn't what you'd expect from a finished game, and the developers don't seem to be doing anything to make it better.

The game is filled with alts that ruin the game for both sides. Logi is inherently unfun and updates don't change that. Some of the latest updates only allow regiments to participate in meaningful ways. These same regiments will horde material as their side loses the war. If you criticize these regiments, they will mass report you resulting in a ban. If you are moderately famous and streaming, they will allow you violate the rules and be toxic for a long time before doing anything at all.
This game is fun. Don't listen to sweaty try-hards who are complaining in these reviews. If you want to jump in and play casually as a front line fighter, you can have a ton of fun.

Otherwise, the game has a trule deep logistics so it is truly pity that for 5 years that players have been complaining about field of view, the developers have not changed it.
Some people were feeding vehicules into the ocean for the Atlantis third faction, we nuked them before they became too strong.

This is my most played game ever on Steam and the first beyond 1000 hours.

Foxhole is one of the most unique games I've ever had the pleasure to experience and never again in my life will I find one so well cared for by its developers or community. I bought this game I believe in 2021 for $20.00 and in that time have received what would be the equivalent of hundreds of dollars in DLC for free with the game's continued development.

This game is a 24/7 persistent MMO war game -> this leads to some of the most intense combined arms combat situations you'll experience in any modern game. This coupled with one fo the greatest (in-game) communities in gaming and you're literally buying one of the greatest purchases of all time.

This is an INTENSE & peaceful game. Players mine, refine, craft, transport, use and build nearly everything and a lot of nuance to game mechanics that otherwise aren't very obvious.

Pros:
In-depth game mechanics
Great in-game community
Constant updates
Logistically focused
Solid Combat
Continuous Improvements
Best value for your money you'll ever spend on Steam
Players get locked to a single faction per War (which can last 30+ days)
Developers honestly love this game

Cons:
Server stability can be wonky (often)
Reddit is filled with..... *passionate* players.
Game is niche, so high turnover of players.
Game is niche, friends you bring in can and will leave game quickly
Game is experiencing (at least a perceived) an increased rate of griefing, bug exploits and 'alts' (players that purchase two accounts instead of one to cheat on one side). This causing a high rate of player attrition and review bombing with a hope to get developer attention of issues.

You will meet great friends in this game across the world and I welcome you to join us! Both factions are filled with really fun people and you can't go wrong picking a side (I play both and switch between Wars)!

Crazy Great Game, Unique of its kind, Be careful if you enjoy it you may play it More than you expect.
Last update 1.0 bring more imbalance and unfinished feature, Need Qol or game is dead

So with the recent flood of reviews coming in, I thought I'd update mine, 4800 hours later.

So I've put in way too much more time, effort, and willpower... and the game still doesn't do it for me. 

Foxhole still reinforces an unfun and boring central gameplay loop which relies on increasingly tedious and involved logistics and supply management. I dislike the fact that only large/organized clans even have the ability to put in the time and effort necessary to maintain fragile facilities which allow for the construction of BT's and SHT's (the two largest tank types in game). In the old, old days, any old group of friends could scrounge up the rmats, emats, and bmats needed for a tank and its ammo, even if petrol was a pain.

I'll probably be updating this soon, but there are my literal shower thoughts.

I love this game but it does have its problems, over all thought its a great game.

side note green man good blue man bad.

This game used to be so good, but devs dont give a shit about the community and the game has gone down hill from their lastest update of 1.0, to many hackers, griefs , alts on this game ruins the experiences to have any fun. Honestly if I could I would get my refund back and invest in another game.

I do not recommend this game. Good ideas, poor implementation. 

Every aspect of this game requires extensive time commitments that should not be expected of people. It‚Äôs designed entirely behind the notion that time should be wasted. This is an absolute disregard for other peoples time. I question the developers ethics.

Very cool! Similar to Hell Let Loose,Red Alert and Axis & Allies mixed together, a true first in gaming. Not without its problems. But overall still a unique niche style that is promising. 

The DEVs are allowing ALTS as a 'pay to win' feature that makes normal play difficult and sometimes impossible. The commanding councils of each faction have went full stockholm about this, endorsing it as a feature of the game. They could easily use machine learning to detect and permanently ban such accounts if they had proper understanding of their self interest.

Another thing is the lack of auto translate in the chat, and no ability to select text to translate it ourselves. They allow names in any alphabet, making it hard to report griefers etc.

The game is ridiculously disrespectful of the player's time when doing logistics. They don't allow you do click and go away while 2000 materials are loaded super slowly, no. They insist on having you babysit every 30 materials and click manually: it is insulting and driving enough people away to slowly kill the game.

Their unwillingness to deal with any of the issues has caused a shrinking player base, merging all servers into one. The game still has significant lag issues in spite of all this. Also they allow game sales from hostile nations, resulting in an influx of players who have no consideration for English.

It's a game that could have been great but has been stunted in its potential by the very people who created it.
Green man Bad Blue man good

At closing in on 1800 hours (most actual play time, not afk to combat AI mechanics get to that later) I find myself continually hoping the dev's will fix the glaringly broken mechanics in their game. I cannot recommend anyone buy this game right now in its current state and have to assume their next game will suffer the same issue's. This game has changed dramatically over the few years ive owned it. On the surface these changes always seemed positive and in the right direction. For instance 1.0 introduced trains and facilities partially to address the LOGI strike that happened and as a QOL improvment to gameplay loops in Logi and production. What was learned quickly was a half backed system that more than doubled the workload in these loops as effectively you needed to to both now. Not an either or. "Dev vision" has become  meme in the community to the point where many of us joke that this game is solely created as a psychological experiment testing peoples breaking limits. This game has NO moderators, appears to have no anti cheat, and the only two report mechanics are atrocious and appear to result in no permanent fixes. The report to dev's system is entirely external, and warns you in advance you will never hear anything further regarding your complaint. The internal system is an easily exploitable system where a small group of people can soft ban you without cause, reason, justification, proof etc. All these players have to do is click a button saying reported and you get first weapons locked, and then booted from server from some time (never longer than a few days in extreme cases). 

Ultimately this leads to the swarm of down voting clearly going on. Every war sees the odd cheater / hacker / alt / griefer abusing the game and ruining it for everyone. past examples have been limited to a single account or two and have likely had little impact on the greater war. This "WAR 100" has seen coordinated strikes across multiple maps to a level never seen before. Previous examples have been someone "alting" a single tank or singularly strategic thing. In one instance alone this war, a clan (with proof) caught someone who eventually drove over 50 end game tanks into the water moments before a full scale invasion, leaving the defenders without a chance to fair play. I've very actively played over the past 1.5 years and the trend from the dev's is clear they simply do not care about their community. I've personally seen the communicate less and less, and continue to push out "fixes" no one asks for or worse yet, bastardised versions of that which the community is screaming for. Im happy to change my review once actual positive actions take place  but to be honest, i dont even foresee lies from the dev's, that would require them to communicate with us.

The Idea that every single piece of equipment that we all use was made by other players behind the front is amazing. 
This means I can play the game either casual by just producing equipment. Or more serious by fighting on the front.

(Edit)
That all having been said, the devs just don‚Äôt care anymore. It‚Äôs extremely upsetting to watch as the game I love begin to go down the drain from the devs ignoring prevalent issues.
So I can‚Äôt recommend this game anymore

After spending at least 700 hours on this game, I‚Äôll straight up say that I both love and hate this game. The game is definitely a unique experience, but its potential is tainted by half-baked mechanics and awful decisions from the devs. If you don‚Äôt want to read the full review just keep in mind that I‚Äôm not recommending this game because of its serious alting problem, the devs‚Äô incompetence in communicating with their playerbase and addressing issues that have plagued the game for years, and the mixed bag gameplay.

[h1]Alts, griefers, moderation[/h1]
The biggest reason why people are currently leaving negative reviews is due to the game‚Äôs horrible alt issues. Some of the alt/grief tactics include dumping supplies in the ocean, mass TKing, giving tanks and supplies to the opposite faction, etc. Unfortunately, alting is so stupidly easy and poorly enforced that it‚Äôs still a thing after all these years. This leads to paranoid vets who would suspect or harass any player below OCDT of alting just because of their low ranks, regardless if they‚Äôre just new players learning the game or actual alts ([url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=x_1JPT19fYA]Cough cough BadManLarry[/url]). The devs do nothing about it and that brings us to today where people have had it.

They also don‚Äôt enforce their code of conduct, like at all. There‚Äôs no in-game moderation and the forums thread talking about the code of conduct was made fun of so much that they locked it last year.

[h1]Devs[/h1]
Now you might think, why not contact the developers? Surely they‚Äôll listen, right? Well, here‚Äôs the thing about Siege Camp: there is no communication with the player base whatsoever. The only ‚Äúcommunication‚Äù you have from them is that one guy on the forums who locks a necroed thread after leaving a copy pasted reply or sometimes locks a thread without saying anything. They don‚Äôt participate in any argument, they don‚Äôt explain what they can, can‚Äôt, will and won‚Äôt do. You just have to wait until the next update and hope that it won‚Äôt just feature new tanks to play with.

The only way to make the devs listen to your issues is if you scream on top of the roof of every single platform, mainly Reddit, Discord and Steam, enough times until they finally listen. I mean for christ‚Äôs sake, it required a full-fledged logi strike to make Siege Camp add basic QoL features for logistics that not only should have been in the game in the first place, but they barely scratched the surface of what the people who arranged the strike have demanded. I‚Äôm sorry, but if you have to whine like a five year old on the forums or start a god damn strike in order to have your issues [b]at least addressed[/b], then you definitely fucked up the formula for transparency.

This lack of communications will bleed through the next points I‚Äôll make down below. Why? Because the problems I‚Äôll mention have been there since the dawn of time!

[h1]Bugs and half-baked gameplay[/h1]
I haven‚Äôt encountered a lot of bugs lately, but a few have burned into my mind. First, you have the climbing that only works half the time. Sometimes I had to mash the space bar just to vault over a bunker right in front of me. Made even worse when you try to climb through rocks where the collisions are all over the place. Second, the rock collisions are garbage. They‚Äôre hard to climb through and you sometimes get stuck until you spam space bar and find the one pixel where the character can vault over. Third, getting ‚Äúarea obstructed‚Äù while digging trenches and bunkers even through there‚Äôs literally nothing in the way. Good way to have your defenses poorly designed because the game itself gets in the way. https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2824661520

Then you have the QoL features that are either missing or half-assed, such as not being able to change stance while cooking a grenade or reloading, not being able to check your inventory while inside a vehicle, not being able to shoot from the window while on a passenger seat, not being able to pull or store supplies in a vehicle because some idiot decided to squad lock an empty logi truck, wasting your mag completely when you reload even if you only fired one round, not being able to climb out the trench while carrying a wounded (You can‚Äôt even put him on the edge and climb up, you have to abandon him if there are no medics around), having vehicles freeze completely during a snowstorm, AKA can‚Äôt be used at all without wasting basic materials and gasoline to build a campfire next to it, after leaving it for only five minutes (This also includes mobile artillery, which makes no fucking sense), setting up queues for regions in a way that population on one side doesn‚Äôt surpass the other side by more than five players (easily exploited by griefers who afk in spawn so that logis can‚Äôt enter the region), etc.

[h1]The Combat[/h1]
Oh god, the combat. As a main infantry like me, the gunplay is some of the worst I‚Äôve ever experienced. Let me sit you through why that is.

When you aim, you have a crosshair as big as your character. The accuracy is completely RNG, so you need to hold still for the crosshair to shrink, AKA make your bullets more likely to hit. If you turn only slightly, the crosshair gets big again and you need to wait another five years to shrink it.

Seems fine. After all, not everyone‚Äôs a navy seal, so it‚Äôs realistic, right? Well no, because the RNG is inconsistent. The biggest issue is that the crosshair‚Äôs size is not distance-based, which means you still have a chance to miss someone at point blank. SMGs are especially affected by this as the RNG can sometimes lead you to spray someone at point blank and miss every single shot, and then get killed in one hit by the guy‚Äôs bolt action. Sometimes I‚Äôm able to quick draw someone far away despite the wide crosshair and other times I miss every single shot against someone right in front of me. This is infuriating because you can always get screwed over by the shitty RNG no matter how good your strategy is. Because of this awful RNG based gunplay, you have shadow dancers, which are players who cheese the mechanic by zig-zagging through no man‚Äôs land and then quick shot three guys with a bolt action rifle if their RNG is good. Sure, it‚Äôs effective‚Ä¶ At breaking immersion!

And the cover system? Incredibly artificial. If the enemy is inside the trench, it‚Äôs impossible to hit him unless you get really close to the edge of the trench and shoot him from above, because your character locks his aim on the ground next to the trench. This applies to any cover. Cover=impossible to hit. Elevation sometimes doesn‚Äôt even matter. Oh, and don‚Äôt get me started on bushes, which make you invisible and impossible to hit without someone charging you with a bayonet or spamming grenades at you.

[h1]God damn grind[/h1]
If there‚Äôs something the game likes to do, it‚Äôs to waste your time. Wait in queue before entering a region, which can range from 30 minutes to an hour (That‚Äôs right, do nothing on the bare bone home island for a fucking hour). Sometimes wait a full minute to respawn because steamrolling the enemy too quickly would hurt their feelings. Wait 5 minutes to dig one trench line. Wait 20 minutes to cook scraps and components in the refinery. Build a base for 4 hours because no one else is doing it, only to have it leveled overnight either from decay, a clan op or a couple of idiots with satchel charges.

The grind is so bad that a lot of people refer to Foxhole as a second job. And what‚Äôs the incentive into doing all this? Uuuuh, you can get commends from other players in order to get promoted, even though the rank system is functionally useless.

[b][REST OF THE REVIEW IN THE COMMENTS][/b]

[h1]Conclusion (6/10)[/h1]
Foxhole is the game that both gave me the best and worst experience. It has the potential to be a great game, but it‚Äôs plagued by awful decisions and barely thought out mechanics.

Absolutely not. The community is toxic and the collies are cheating blaintently and the devds dont give a rats a** about any of it. They leave the game to die without doing anything about the cheaters and alters.

"TL;DR" : go to the last line

- The devs do not listen at all to any community feedback, nor say whatever they're planning/doing

- The servers often lag for no reason (even when there's not even 10 people connected)

- The servers often (on a daily basis) restart with a.. 30 seconds notice. And you'll be disconnected for at least 5 minutes. In a few (but rare) cases, the servers totally crashed, the previous occurence of a crash was 3 weeks ago, when the servers were offline for many hours. Sometimes during a server crash/restart (the server restarts are controlled by the devs) the servers will have a "rollback" leading you to lose the stuffs you had previously crafted/farmed

- The community is quite toxic - not only a few isolated elements, toxic in wide proportions, with people actively griefing people/teams, insulting, etc..

- The clan is formed around clans, and there's a lot of issues with clans widely known for stealing/teamkilling/griefing

- There's no moderation (a moderation team existed before, consisting of players elected by the devs to act as moderators, but they massively abused their commands in order to help their favoured faction / to grief the opposite faction ; at least one of the moderators is also quite famous for having used hacks)

- The new content devs add (always out of nowhere, when nobody asked for it, which will always worsen a gameplay already bad) is systematically unbalanced and buggy, and needs a few patches to be fixed. Mostly because, despite being tested by players on a public testing server, the devs don't read the feedbacks nor the bug reports nor any ticket filled by the players

- Many people use hacking softwares in the game, as this game do not have any anti-cheat (afaik, the most common hack is to remove the "fog of war" which limits a player' vision by night time - this hack is called "nightvision" among the community)

- Many people who are actively playing in a faction will create an "alternative account" (basically create another steam account and buy the game with it) in the opposite faction in order to grief it (usually, it ranges from stealing tanks to dumping vehicles into the rivers - as dumping a vehicle into a river/sea will destroy it - with some of them placing vehicles in front of automated defenses to prevent them from firing). The devs have never adressed anything against this behavior, as more alternative accounts means more money

- Many of the game features (especially the building aspect of the game) require a constant grinding - if you ever want to build something, you'll have to log in everyday to supply it with a resource you'll have to farm and craft in order to prevent your buildings from disappearing

- The devs don't care at all about anything listed above, as each of these issues have been around for at least two years with no response from the devs

all in all while there have been moments I've had fun the sheer amount of glaring issues with this game really out weighs the positives and the devs need a kick in the ass and i have no hope for their next game

Updated Review:

Game is fun and addictive but I can't recommend it in it's current state.

Review is written from a Warden only player;

The main positives are the community and the feeling of immersion in a persistent world game;
- Community is brilliant, provided you are a team player.
- Welcoming towards new players
- When things come together it is rewarding.
- Game play is vast enough to accommodate a lot of interests.

Why i cannot recommend it right now (understandably it is early access);
- Logistics is unrewarding (but essential).
- Fighting / shooting can be buggy and feel cheap at times.
- You need hours to properly set anything up (this is less relevant to those who can reliably spend 5+ hours a day on the game.)
- Community moderation is non transparant meaning issues are never really addressed.
- Game moderation is almost non existant unless you are friends with a moderator - even then repeat offenders are never penalised. Case in point - you could spend 24 real life hours on something just have a "alt" who will buy the game just to sabotage your team come along and blow up / toss your inventory into the ocean. Despite providing proof, there has been no action from the devs or community management to stop this - the issue has become worse in the 2 years since my previous review. 

Final Note:

Great game - i have enjoyed playing it but in its current state i would tell new players to avoid. The  devs and moderation seemingly have no ambition to support it - its essentially an EA cash grab, that despite being an MMO type game they have no intention to support it in a meaningful way post patch 1.0. This even includes communicating there plans going forward - you will get fun out of it, but unless the devs step up and combat the griefing and make logistics more tolerable, you may have a dead game in a year meaning your money is wasted.

Where should I start...?

I have never enjoyed a game as much as Foxhole in my 20+ years of gaming history, no wonder I put 3k hours into it in less than 2 years (~125 days). The idea behind the game is just wonderful, you can do whatever you want: everything you do has an impact on the outcome of the war, including scrapping, logistics, building, fighting, partisaning and maintaining.

Let me share my 3k hours experience with you:
-However the amount of joy coming from these activities are not equally provided: builders get zero acknowledgements whereas if you transport some goods to a frontline with full pop, you can just easily climb the rank ladder, no matter whether your resources were useful or not. Ranks don't give any advantages of course. Have you ever tried rebuilding a frontline that moved? Well, good luck mammoning the tier 2 trenches with a total of 66 mammons for a single trench completely dehusked, filling in craters alone, or simply destroying unwanted/badly placed friendly structures to get weapon restricted every 20 minutes.

- Alts (secondary accounts) are a serious problem indeed. Other games issue hardware bans, here they get a couple of hours timeout and can continue their behaviour the same as before, probably unnoticed. They drive free tanks, loaded freighters and trucks to the enemy or sink them, destroy friendly structures (like bridges or generator rooms for Storm Cannons) or modify garrison modifications so it stops teching overnight. They get access to regiment stockpiles and dump them into water, enemy hands or release them to public. You may ask why public goods are bad? Pulling from public takes years compared to private stockpiles, so good luck pulling thousands of crates. (Basically alts are partisans, but you can't really catch and punish them..)

- Mid/Frontline resource fields become useless over time. It is completely a waste of time to gather resources in the midline and to transport them to backline refineries even with the help of trains.

- Factories were hyped so much when they came out that everyone started building facilities, which eventually decayed in 2-5 days since the lack of maintenance and high Garrison Supply consumption. So many resources and time wasted on facilities even as of today.

- In the beginning, I spent countless hours of trying to understand some of the game logics by reading the unofficial Foxhole wiki, maintained by some volunteers. The game lacks of ingame instructions for new players. There is a training field in the home region, but for example how to claim a border base is not explained AT ALL, which should be compulsory... I could mention dozens of others like the above mentioned.

- Nevertheless, the main issue is the balance of the game. Developers promised to keep the game assymmetric which in theory sounds a good idea, but very hard to maintain to avoid being one technology/side OP then balancing (= completely nerfing) so the other faction gets the advantage.
- Although the technology tree got a final shape by the War 100 so it is much easier to follow and understand (no tech skip anymore, no tech choices in a single tier anymore, Iron and Alu requirements were cut off by a 0 digit, and proto vehicle kits can now be built with bmats and repairable with hammer unlike many wars before when proto tanks cost rmat and could be repaired only in garages and not by hammer). Unfortunately most new players don't even know what alu and iron/copper are used for because of the lack of instructions. Especially with the facility update, you can't directly build/MPF (Mass Produce) all types of tanks.
- It is extremely hard to stream Foxhole because of streamsnipers and intel-leak. When 1.0 came out, 8 out of 10 supported streamers were on Colonial side, even nowadays it is still more preferred than the Warden side. Simps and followers and even other faction's alts would go to say hi/kill the streamer for 1 minute fame.
- Every region has a counterpart in this assymmetric world, which are very often unbalanced. Some parts of the map should be reworked. Normal North vs South layout, Wardens start with Loggerhead with 3 bridges to be attacked from, while its counterpart Fort Duncan can be attacked only from 1 bridge. Lockheed can be captured from south with 1 single tank because with the rapid decay zone, you literally can't build any defenses south of the TH, compared to its counterpart Mercy's Wish which can be defended from all sides. Also, there is the bulwark (the huge wall) in the south with only a few gaps (usually covered with AI/ghouses) to cross that makes very hard for partisans from north side to cross. In the north, there is nothing stopping you to cross to any of the northern hexagons. Camp Omicron and Anchor Beach are also in my top5 list to be reworked due to their closeness to the border/rapid decay zone.
- Satchels (Alligator Charge) in lategame just ruin the game. You get 1 person with a Heavy Machine Gun to suppress rifle/MG garrisons while the other destroys in less than 5 mins the structures that were built/teched by hard work of lots of people in the past couple of real time days.
- And one of the most crucial problem of the game: the population. People lose interest over time, structures are not planned to upkeep for 40+ days (like War 100), nightcap can't be QRF-ed (especially satchel charges overnight), etc. This map is not designed for 1200 players at low-peak hours for sure, but 2000 players on a typical weekday is not enough either. It affects both the winning and the losing side as well: obviously it is always demoralizing to be on the losing/defending side, but the long queues (30-40 players with 1 hour+ queue) on the winning side are a pain as well.
- Finally of course lots of bugs, glitches, server lags, etc. are on my list.

[b]The game in its current state is not recommended: devs aren't listening to player feedback and always favorize only one faction. I lost interest, I don't enjoy playing it anymore as much as I have done in the last 2 years. Ah yeah, devs want to release Anvil, the Foxhole copy in medieval times so probably the playerbase from Foxhole will shift to Anvil eventually. Don't support these devs![/b]

PS: You can call me a salty vet, but before you do, read other "salty vet" reviews on steam as well. ;) Thank you!
Made a lot of good friends and had a lot of good times while playing this game. 10/10 would Satchel Warden concrete and Storm Cannons again

Developers stop caring about this game

It‚Äôs a shit game now

Was a great game about a year ago it‚Äôs sad to see it in this state

Even if you do buy this game it‚Äôs unlikely you will have fun as there are not many players

The cycle goes like this grind ‚Äî> leave ‚Äî> come back to find a alt , cheater, griefer etc. has destroyed your stuff ‚Äî> remember when the game was fun ‚Äî> stop playing

TLDR: I have been playing this game since 2019. It really feels like taking meth. It beats you senseless yet you come back every time for the highs. But this dogwater game and dogwater devs dont respect me, nor my time, nor anyone else in this community, so I'll give them the same.


-Alts and cheaters have been an "old problem" even when I joined back in 2019. They did nothing to fix the issue to this day, even tho we told them a million times. Good luck reporting them.

-Balance has been broken ever since the asymmetry update. They clearly dont know how to balance units, just throw one overpowered vehicle to one faction, then the other when they complain on discord or reddit(LTD+AP mortarHT, 3x more costly HE rocket vs ISG, broken sniper meta etc.) - just bring back symmetry already. Not to mention adding vehicles that are downright useless and only there to bloat the vehicle lineup, but never get used. Also the devs practically told us on discord that they dont give a damn about suggestions, they will select the ones they personally like, not the ones that are needed.

-Laggy servers, frequent disconnects. Complained about this back in early 2020 when there were only around 300 to 500 players here. They did nothing, now its even worse. Shitty performance all round. Not to mention the game breaking bugs and bugs in general that have been in the game for ages. Bad code is not an excuse for lack of action. 

-Its so grindy you might just mistake it for War Thunder. Good luck spending 6 hours mining and refining resources, building the vehicle, the ammo, getting crew if you want to do tank combat. Then flip a coin and either do marginally good or die in the first minute, because driver Bobby drove onto a mine and you got ganged by the enemy. If you get killed by a clan because you try to take away a parked vehicle, now you understand why.

-Infantry combat is dead. Good luck getting even close with all the arty, the grenade spam, machine guns and launchers around. Also I hope you like trenches, because you gonna spend a lot of time in those. I hate trenches....

-Good luck finding out what stats your guns have, since the wiki is outdated and you have to datamine the game to find out anything about your equipment. Not to mention that dev team is not transparent, they dont communicate and sometimes outright shadow update the game without any mention in the logs.

-Moderation is clearly biased. Point out a problem they dont like and you might just get banned or muted on forums. Also if you have the connection, you can get away with a lot more things.

-Devs keep telling us that they dont want to push us into clans, but in reality you either have to be in a clan or find really good players in order to do most of the things in the game. Previously you could hop in and do infantry, arty, and even logi alone, but today infantry combat is dead, arty needs at least 3 people to do any damage and bigger logi hubs need more people to make sure the damn site does not decay and die. Dont even talk about tank combat.

-Dont even mention logi, if you like getting carpal tunnel while mining or like driving trucks for hours, you gonna love this. Also I hope you like waiting, those mats will be cooking in the refinery for a while. Hope you dont get partizaned while going to the front! Enjoy your stay in Yugoslavia.

-I'm not the building type, but if you are, you're shit out of luck. Some buildings are just too weak to be worth it to build. If you want to build a bunker complex, I pity you. You'll have to ask people to vote for the upgrades and essential stuff like AT and arty bunkers take irl days to get.

-Cross faction mic is gone. Why?

Thats the end of my rambling, I might just edit this if something else comes to my mind to add.
I dont care if you are a Collie, a Warden or take no sides or someone new who did not get this game yet, this game does not respect you, the devs dont care, so you should not too unless they change stuff. I highly doubt that tho, since 1.0 came out, they already announced their new game in the works, so I wont be surprised if they just abandoned this game and move on.

Foxhole is a unique game which you can't find anywhere else, you can maybe find the gunplay in a game like running with rifles, maybe squad can scratch the itch for a bit but the idea of a persistent, up to a month long war to get invested in is not something you find anywhere else, this shit is like crack cocaine.

The amount of different things you can do in Foxhole is insane, there is always something fun to do either alone or with a group. You can just shoot the shit in the frontline with some pals or go mine some scrap and grind out guns for the frontline, you can help in facilities to create shells for the artillery or you can grab a tank with some randoms and be the armoured fist if you get bored of those others, there is probably something for everyone in this game.

A great game ruined by inaction from the development team.


The updates are few and months apart, and they often focus on introducing content instead of much needed QoL or bug fixing.

And in those months there is little to no communication from the Dev side on anything.

People have raised issues over the fact that accounts that only destroy friendly vehicles and supplies do not get permabanned. The community tracks those accounts and constantly reports them but the devs do not take any hard stance.

If the concept of a persistent war game interests you, I strongly encourage you to pass on Foxhole until changes happen.

This used the be my favorite game of all time.   So many amazing moments, stories, so many companions made, alliances formed.  The game encouraged a meta that transcended the game, such as press clans reporting on the war, war councils where large clans decided the plans for the war‚Ä¶. You used to be able to have a moment with the enemy, stop firing, and just talk.   We used to sneak into enemy territory and hide in the bushes and start talking to just freak the enemy out.  No other game gave you that.  Now - cross faction voice chat is gone, to make room for more players per map, which doesn‚Äôt work because the game has an influx of alt accounts that log on in the wee hours and dump HOURS of someone‚Äôs work into the water.  And the devs don‚Äôt do anything about it.  They used to be amazing, you would be able to ask them to help them resolve a bug, they‚Äôd show up and help you out, or at least a mod.  Now the mods are gone, all cheating is left unpunished, and you can‚Äôt even complain about it together with the enemy like we used to.  The devs won‚Äôt even give us a ‚Äúmy bad, was on vacation, we‚Äôll look into it‚Äù they just don‚Äôt care, and as far as they see, alternate accounts make more money for them.  They throw more ‚Äúfeatures‚Äù at the game to keep it relevant while these ‚Äúfeatures‚Äù break the game more and more and stock bug after bug.  

I‚Äôm fucking sorry siege camp, or as I remember you in kinder times, clap foot.  You gave up on us.  You gave us something we loved and then you stopped listening and ruined it for us.  That‚Äôs fucking terrible.  And we payed you for it.  

Even after this I hope you see your community loves this game and we just want to keep loving it.  It‚Äôs just really, really hard, because you‚Äôre making it this way.

This game has consumed alot of hours from me, i've been playing since there was only 9 maps in a 3x3 space where you had to physically push a push-machinegun from the rear inorder to get it to the front, i was there when trenches were first added and made hell trenches advancing through roads towards enemy town halls to rifle fire the building to the ground, i've fought hopeless wars inorder to gain War Objectives; achievements of having held sweet bugger all objective towns but still survived several days inorder to gain bragging rights even when it all comes crumbling down.

Single player games have nothing on the high of socially interacting upon the battlefield with your friends to win a month long fight over digital space, i've spent hours in the wee morning discussing philosophy with blokes while manning a post, digging trenches, or moving supplies back and forth moving the industry along, i've joined clans for logistical movements and streamers zerg rush clans to support pushes on the fringes of fronts only to have the logi be useless in the end or the territory gained be lost in the ensuing hours because everybody eventually had to log off to sleep.

Its a great game, but the communications are ever failing; Voice Chat errors that prevent you from speaking or being heard happen without announcement and are only revealed when you go into options.
There used to be Inter Team Communication; you would be able to talk locally to your enemies as you could to any of your teammates, mocking them or sweet talking them into not throwing a grenade into your trench... This is replaced by text only excused that the network couldn't handle it when in actuality it was probably because you could abuse enemy players or get them into trouble with their government (BingChilling). While I did abuse this system (I blew into my mic when near enemy players to annoy them into trying to hunt me down) its no excuse when we have auto recording devices to account for any law breaking that may occur between people playing video games on the internet.

Here comes the last bit of criticism that brought me to writing a review upon request by my friends who have been enjoying this game for months if not years; Cheating!

Cheating in some cultures is perfectly permissible against others if they leave themselves open; sitting invisible in a bush while enemy soldiers pass by inorder to murder their medics, standing atop a cliff where the enemy cannot easily get at you or even aim at you has been an age old method of securing some particular fronts (Jade Cove has a stupidly defensible cliff north of it for the wardens to hold off colonial attacks), creating terribly indefensible trenches infront of your bunker base that your opponent will have to hop over several times in awkward manners only to be gunned down by your automated machine-gun bunkers is terribly time consuming to deal with or must leave that area ignored as you seek another front to push.

This is unsportsmanlike like behaviour that can hold the enemy off the area long enough for them to quit the fight in exhaustion or bring material up to deal with; bush tactics can be countered by putting Watch Towers that act as stationary UAVs to let those with the equipment know about them & also is given for a second upon accessing spawn points so it doesn't allow for a long hold off point, Cliffs can be mortared with shrapnel shells as there is no cover atop those forsaken crags and then captured in the night to turn the high ground against your enemy, stifling trenches can be destroyed the same as any defenses by utilizing explosives to wear them down as the most frontline trenches cannot be effectively repaired without exposing engineers to great danger and risk losing all their supplies.

And here's the rub with people cheating using Alt Accounts; Every tactic can be countered, motorized anti tank guns are near on defenseless against infantry with an anti structure explosive, the most robust and perfectly placed bunkerbase can be wiped out by dedicated artillery crews manning entrenched guns replacing their counter batteried crews via nearby dedicated garrison base, bridge battles are over when a location behind them is conquered leaving the dedicated defenses facing the wrong direction.

A person on your team driving a flatbed with 60 stacks of basic materials into the ocean is uncounterable and unnoticed, A person on your team upgrading your bunker base with weakening spots (a tier one trench added and destroyed removes the entire structure) or making generator rooms which lower the integrity of the entire structure is uncounterable, A person waiting behind the front with a vehicle and coordinating with the opposite team to rush his vehicle forward and trap an allied tank into being destroyed is uncounterable.
All uncounterable options are banworthy, but so what. You win, your team gets the upperhand and demoralizes the enemy team while morally supporting your own team.

Rust has this problem, they solve it by Banning The Entire Clan related to the activity thus moralizing those people who have been wronged in a uncounterable manner. We don't get any such satisfaction in this game.
What can be done; vote with your reviews, hold them against the developers, they are public servants accountable to their player base.

And unlike in real life where nothing good happens for the people; if this ends up ruining the game the developers who failed their player base get to hang the shame of it around their necks to whatever job they go to next.

Their Move.
I love the game, but the devs act like negligent parents.

I absolutely love foxhole and some of my most memorable recent gaming experiences have come from it but all at a cost sadly. The concept is very unique and whilst niche, fills that niche perfectly. The art style is superb, top down view is really enjoyable even coming from someone who's always used to playing FPS's, the teamwork and comradery is nearly unmatched with some wonderful players in both factions but in its current state I wouldn't recommend it for people who aren't already deadset on buying it. As many other reviews have addressed, alting (the process of bypassing the faction lock by purchasing another account and then using that to destroy the opposing faction internally) has become a rampant problem and there is little to suggest any actual dev response to it. Spending thousands of collective hours to build a tank, base, operation setup ect can be very rewarding when it gets pulled off but its increasingly more common to find alts go and purposefully destroy all that prep in the span of 1 hour with no repercussion. Toxicity also exists typically with people who have sunk so many hours into the game that they feel entitled to do anything however this is at least personally less of something I have encountered. Most it comes down to a few individuals or clans which do everything from mass report friendlies for now following specific orders to exploiting. Then you have the balance which at the current point in time is very lackluster with some egregious cases of guns or vehicles being leagues better or far more effective to winning wars than others which results in a serious faction inbalance problem that will become more noticeable as one plays the game. Whilst this will always be a point of contention as very few people can see past their own faction and thus never acknowledging the problem, it never the less exists and has only seemed to get worse in recent updates. This isn't helped by the fact that dev communication on the topic is almost nonexistent and so people have just become really demotivated to do much. Bugs also plague many parts of the game from minor but annoying ones such as getting stuck in flat terrain for no reason to server desync resulting in you being thrown far off the road whilst driving or game disconnecting losing an entire days worth of work in a moment with the worst being the many nuke (an end game weapon that can change the tide of a war) bugs with some being stupidly simple exploits to others being completely overpowered bugs that people can literally just accidentally trigger by playing the game allowing for the course of a war to be changed simply by a lack of polish on one of the most game changing features present. As I am not the most proficient in logistics I will not comment on the state of that but many others have highlighted complaints with it that need to be addressed as logistics is the core backbone of the game with everything deriving from that working.

In the end foxhole is a great game with many potentials from people who want to do nothing but make goods and ship them around to frontline to artillery crew, firefighters, medics, tank commanders, train drivers, builders, snipers, grenadiers and the list goes on but despite all of its unique and compelling attributes, the current negative state of the game has overshadowed them making it a lot harder to enjoy the fun parts of the game without having to curse all the bugs, exploits, balancing issues and lack of communication that come with it really taking away from what is at its core a beautiful one of a kind experience. If you already like the look of foxhole then new players are always welcomed and I hope this review doesn't turn away aspiring players but more just informs them of what they are signing up to and maybe to hold off a bit until things hopefully get a bit better.

A friend of mine put it best saying: "The devs do not communicate with the community, nor try to police it or cooperate with the community trying to police itself. Reporting people for transphobia, homophobia or outright Nazism is met with the devs ignoring the ticket, or responding to it and then not punishing the offender." Toxicity has been a problem that has been growing in foxhole for a long time, and the developers have pushed the game in a direction that it doesn't really feel immersive or fun anymore to just be a soldier in this massive MMO war. When I first played, things were less static and it felt like as an individual you could make a difference. Less so by just lone wolfing it as a solo player but by just working together as a whole, without the need for clan level organization for every single thing. Now any front I go to is going to be either a bridge battle or a slugging match between bunker bases. If you want good fun fights with urban combat or in open terrain like is fitting and immersive for the era and vibe foxhole goes for, you have to basically luck out and be on at the right time.

Not all of this is stuff that is able to be completely fixed. Not every moment you log into foxhole is gonna be a fun battle, toxcitiy is never going to be completely gone, and of course there is going to be a need for clans and their more organized nature in many aspects of the game. But frankly now it feels like the game can't really even be enjoyed all that well without a clan, without running into nazis and transphobes, and without having to slog first through likely weeks of static unfun fighting. I am aware of the nature of what kind of game foxhole is, where there very much has to be a carrot and a stick. The issue is that now there is no carrot. We are just told to chase sticks.

A unique concept for a game, that is absolutely ruined by the devs' vision and the toxic community surrounding it, that the devs do absolutely nothing to try and fix.

This game qualifies as severe self-harm, because everything from communicating with most of the community, to playing the game itself is grind that punishes you severely for not logging on for even an hour, hence the atrocious player retention the game has.

The devs do not communicate with the community, nor try to police it or cooperate with the community trying to police itself. Reporting people for transphobia, homophobia or outright Nazism is met with the devs ignoring the ticket, or responding to it and then not punishing the offender.

The devs' vision constitutes of forcing all the players to follow how they envision things to work, while refusing to accept how the players decide to play it and change their vision to accomodate the playerbase. Whether it be refusing to reduce the map size to accomodate the dwindling population of the game at points, refusing to give us the old map layout for a war to enjoy it, doing nothing but adding new content without fixing the broken or severely flawed content already in the game, or getting rid of the old special events (or making them very rare), be it relic wars or Dead Harvest (the Halloween event with mechs).

The lack of moderation, or easy fixes to prevent griefing, such as the addition of logs that have been requested by the community for years, are ignored, because it means the devs might have to do stuff, or pay actual moderators to moderate their game. That has allowed the game to be filled with griefers and alts.

The devs have also all but moved on to their next game, which is as, if not more, grindy than Foxhole currently is.
